snippet: While the company’s Lumia smartphones continued to sell well, sales of its basic models, which make up the bulk of its business, took a dive.
abstract: Nokia reports first-quarter loss of 272 million euros, down from 978 million euros in same period a year earlier; reports 20 percent decline in quarterly sales, adding to investor anxiety over company's ability to execute turnaround.
lead_paragraph: While the company’s Lumia smartphones continued to sell well, sales of its basic models, which make up the bulk of its business, took a dive.

headline.main: Nokia Trims Loss, but Sales Fall
headline.print_headline: Nokia Sales Fall, but Loss Is Narrower
